document_data.mainbody:
Chill was a useful cantrip that apprentice wizards could learn. It reduced the temperature of a quantity of liquid or solid matter.
This cantrip had a range of .The original description of this cantrip in Dragon #59 allowed for a limited effect on living things, but this was removed in Wizards Spell Compendium Volume Four. liquids and solids that amounted to no more than  in volume. The drop in temperature was about 40 ℉ ( ℃) but could not go below . The cantrip and temperature change were nearly instantaneous but thereafter the chilled material acted normally in the conditions surrounding it, slowly warming back up to the ambient temperature.
This cantrip required verbal and somatic components to cast. The caster gave a low whistle while making a downward-pointing gesture with the thumb.
